name: ListMaintenanceWindows
description:
Retrieve existing maintenance windows with optional filters.

Use this tool to list maintenance windows, which temporarily disable services for specific periods. You can filter the results by service, team, or by time (past, present, future).

parameters.name: accept_header_version
parameters.description: Use the 'Accept' header to specify the API versioning for the request.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specifies the media type of the request body. Use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: name_filter_query
parameters.description: Filter results to show only maintenance windows whose name matches this query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of maintenance window results returned per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Specifies the starting point for pagination in search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: team_ids
parameters.description: An array of team IDs to filter maintenance windows. Requires the 'teams' ability.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.name: service_ids
parameters.description: An array of service IDs to filter results. Only maintenance windows related to these services will be included.

value_schema.description: An array of service IDs. Only results related to these services will be returned.

parameters.name: include_additional_models
parameters.description: Specify additional models to include in the response. Options are 'teams', 'services', or 'users'.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: maintenance_window_state_filter
parameters.description: Filter maintenance windows by state: past, future, ongoing, open, or all.

value_schema.description: Only return maintenance windows in a given state.

parameters.name: include_total_count
parameters.description: Set to true to include the total count of maintenance windows in the response, which may slow down response times.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: team_ids[]
parameters.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.name: service_ids[]
parameters.description: An array of service IDs. Only results related to these services will be returned.

value_schema.description: An array of service IDs. Only results related to these services will be returned.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Only return maintenance windows in a given state.

value_schema.description: Only return maintenance windows in a given state.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
